PIC Code/CustomSNTP.c
Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 ///@file CustomSNTP.c
00002 ///@brief  Custom version of SNTP
00003 
00004 /*********************************************************************
00005  *
00006  *      Simple Network Time Protocol (SNTP) Client Version 3
00007  *  Module for Microchip TCP/IP Stack
00008  *       -Locates an NTP Server from public site using DNS
00009  *       -Requests UTC time using SNTP and updates SNTPTime structure
00010  *        periodically, according to NTP_QUERY_INTERVAL value
00011  *      - Reference: RFC 1305
00012  *
00013  *********************************************************************
00014  * FileName:        SNTP.c
00015  * Dependencies:    UDP, ARP, DNS, Tick
00016  * Processor:       PIC18, PIC24F, PIC24H, dsPIC30F, dsPIC33F, PIC32
00017  * Compiler:        Microchip C32 v1.00 or higher
00018  *                                      Microchip C30 v3.01 or higher
00019  *                                      Microchip C18 v3.13 or higher
00020  *                                      HI-TECH PICC-18 STD 9.50PL3 or higher
00021  * Company:         Microchip Technology, Inc.
00022  *
00023  * Software License Agreement
00024  *
00025  * Copyright (C) 2002-2008 Microchip Technology Inc.  All rights 
00026  * reserved.

00029  * distribute: 
00030  * (i)  the Software when embedded on a Microchip microcontroller or 
00031  *      digital signal controller product ("Device") which is 
00032  *      integrated into Licensee's product; or
00033  * (ii) ONLY the Software driver source files ENC28J60.c and 
00034  *      ENC28J60.h ported to a non-Microchip device used in 
00035  *      conjunction with a Microchip ethernet controller for the 
00036  *      sole purpose of interfacing with the ethernet controller.

00069 /// Defines how frequently to resynchronize the date/time (default: 10 minutes)
00070 #define NTP_QUERY_INTERVAL              (10ull*60ull * TICK_SECOND)
00071 
00072 /// Defines how long to wait to retry an update after a failure.
00073 /// Updates may take up to 6 seconds to fail, so this 14 second delay is actually only an 8-second retry.
00074 #define NTP_FAST_QUERY_INTERVAL (14ull * TICK_SECOND)
00075 
00076 /// Port for contacting NTP servers
00077 #define NTP_SERVER_PORT                 (123ul)
00078 
00079 /// Reference Epoch to use.  (default: 01-Jan-1970 00:00:00)
00080 #define NTP_EPOCH                               (86400ul * (365ul * 70ul + 17ul))
00081 
00082 /// Defines how long to wait before assuming the require has failed
00083 #define NTP_REPLY_TIMEOUT               (6ul*TICK_SECOND)
00084 
00085 
00086 
00087 
00088 // These are normally available network time servers.
00089 // The actual IP returned from the pool will vary every
00090 // minute so as to spread the load around stratum 1 timeservers.
00091 // For best accuracy and network overhead you should locate the 
00092 // pool server closest to your geography, but it will still work
00093 // if you use the global pool.ntp.org address or choose the wrong 
00094 // one or ship your embedded device to another geography.
00095 //#define NTP_SERVER    "pool.ntp.org"
00096 //#define NTP_SERVER    "europe.pool.ntp.org"
00097 //#define NTP_SERVER    "asia.pool.ntp.org"
00098 //#define NTP_SERVER    "oceania.pool.ntp.org"
00099 //#define NTP_SERVER    "north-america.pool.ntp.org"
00100 //#define NTP_SERVER    "south-america.pool.ntp.org"
00101 //#define NTP_SERVER    "africa.pool.ntp.org"
00102 
00103 /// Defines the structure of an NTP packet
00104 typedef struct _NTP_PACKET
00105 {
00106         struct
00107         {
00108                 BYTE mode                       : 3;    ///< NTP mode
00109                 BYTE versionNumber      : 3;    ///< SNTP version number
00110                 BYTE leapIndicator      : 2;    ///< Leap second indicator
00111         } flags;                                                ///< Flags for the packet
00112 
00113         BYTE stratum;                                   ///< Stratum level of local clock
00114         CHAR poll;                                              ///< Poll interval
00115         CHAR precision;                                 ///< Precision (seconds to nearest power of 2)
00116         DWORD root_delay;                               ///< Root delay between local machine and server
00117         DWORD root_dispersion;                  ///< Root dispersion (maximum error)
00118         DWORD ref_identifier;                   ///< Reference clock identifier
00119         DWORD ref_ts_secs;                              ///< Reference timestamp (in seconds)
00120         DWORD ref_ts_fraq;                              ///< Reference timestamp (fractions)
00121         DWORD orig_ts_secs;                             ///< Origination timestamp (in seconds)
00122         DWORD orig_ts_fraq;                             ///< Origination timestamp (fractions)
00123         DWORD recv_ts_secs;                             ///< Time at which request arrived at sender (seconds)
00124         DWORD recv_ts_fraq;                             ///< Time at which request arrived at sender (fractions)
00125         DWORD tx_ts_secs;                               ///< Time at which request left sender (seconds)
00126         DWORD tx_ts_fraq;                               ///< Time at which request left sender (fractions)
00127 } NTP_PACKET;
00128 
00129 
00130 /// Seconds value obtained by last update
00131 DWORD dwSNTPSeconds = 0;
00132 
00133 /// Tick count of last update
00134 DWORD dwLastUpdateTick;
00135 
00136 /// stores the response from a SNTP test        
00137 int NTPTestResponse; 
00138 SNTPStates SNTPState;

00140 //******************************************************************************
00141 /// Prints the NTP server that if configured 
00142 void HTTPPrint_NTPServer (void) {
00143         
00144         TCPPutArray(sktHTTP, xPLConfig.NTP_Server, strlen(xPLConfig.NTP_Server));       
00145 }

00147 //******************************************************************************

00149 /// Prints Is AES active, if no then NTP is not enabled
00150 void HTTPPrint_AES_Active (void) {
00151 
00152         TCPPut(sktHTTP, (xPLConfig.Use_AES?'1':'0'));
00153 
00154 }

00158 /// Prints the last time update
00159 void HTTPPrint_NTPLastUpdate (void) {
00160 
00161 #if defined(STACK_USE_SNTP_CLIENT)
00162         char Tempdigit[12];
00163 
00164         uitoa(dwLastUpdateTick,   Tempdigit);
00165         TCPPutArray(sktHTTP, Tempdigit, strlen((char*)Tempdigit));      
00166 #endif
00167 }
00168

00170 //******************************************************************************
00171 
00172 /// Prints the current EPOC
00173 void HTTPPrint_CurrentEPOC (void) {
00174 #if defined(STACK_USE_SNTP_CLIENT)
00175         char Tempdigit[12];
00176         
00177         uitoa((SNTPGetUTCSeconds() / TICK_SECOND), Tempdigit);
00178         TCPPutArray(sktHTTP, Tempdigit, strlen((char*)Tempdigit));      
00179 #endif
00180 }

00183 //*****************************************************************************
00184 
00185 /// For debug purposes, prints the result code
00186 void HTTPPrint_SNTPTestOutput (void) {
00187         
00188         // Set a flag to indicate not finished
00189         curHTTP.callbackPos = 1;
00190 
00191         // Make sure there's enough output space
00192         if(TCPIsPutReady(sktHTTP) < 15)
00193                 return;
00194         
00195         if (NTPTestResponse == NTP_TEST_COMPLETED)
00196                 TCPPutROMString(sktHTTP, (ROM BYTE*)"Successful");
00197         else if (NTPTestResponse == NTP_TEST_DNSERROR)
00198                 TCPPutROMString(sktHTTP, (ROM BYTE*)"DNS error");
00199         else if (NTPTestResponse == NTP_TEST_ARPERROR)
00200                 TCPPutROMString(sktHTTP, (ROM BYTE*)"ARP error");
00201         else if (NTPTestResponse == NTP_TEST_TIMEOUT)
00202                 TCPPutROMString(sktHTTP, (ROM BYTE*)"Time out");
00203         else 
00204                 TCPPutROMString(sktHTTP, (ROM BYTE*)"Error unkown");
00205         
00206         // Indicate that we're done
00207         curHTTP.callbackPos = 0x00;
00208         NTPTestResponse = NTP_TEST_DONE;
00209         return;         
00210 }

00213 /*****************************************************************************
00214   Function:
00215         void SNTPClient(void)
00216 
00217   Summary:
00218         Periodically checks the current time from a pool of servers.
00219 
00220   Description:
00221         This function periodically checks a pool of time servers to obtain the
00222         current date/time.
00223 
00224   Precondition:
00225         UDP is initialized.
00226 
00227   Parameters:
00228         None
00229 
00230   Returns:
00231         None
00232         
00233   Remarks:
00234         This function requires once available UDP socket while processing, but
00235         frees that socket when the SNTP module is idle.
00236   ***************************************************************************/
00237 void SNTPClient(void)
00238 {
00239         NTP_PACKET                      pkt;
00240         WORD                            w;
00241         static NODE_INFO        Server;
00242         static DWORD            NTPdwTimer;
00243         static UDP_SOCKET       MySocket;
00244 
00245 
00246 
00247         switch(SNTPState)
00248         {
00249                 case SM_HOME:
00250 
00251 // JN added     next 2 lines                    
00252                         // If encryption is not needed then disable NTP
00253                         #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00254                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"SNTP: started...\r\n");
00255                         #endif
00256 
00257 
00258                         if (xPLConfig.Use_AES == FALSE) {
00259                                 NTPTestResponse = NTP_TEST_TIMEOUT;
00260                                 break;
00261                         }
00262                         
00263                         #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00264                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"SNTP: started\r\n");
00265                         #endif
00266                         // Obtain ownership of the DNS resolution module
00267                         if(!DNSBeginUsage())
00268                                 break;
00269 
00270                         #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00271                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"SNTP: DNS ownership obtained\r\n");
00272                         #endif
00273                                 
00274 // JN changed next 2 lines
00275                         // Obtain the IP address associated with the server name
00276                         //DNSResolveROM((ROM BYTE*)NTP_SERVER, DNS_TYPE_A);
00277                         DNSResolve((BYTE*) xPLConfig.NTP_Server,  DNS_TYPE_A);
00278                         
00279                         NTPdwTimer = TickGet();
00280                         SNTPState = SM_NAME_RESOLVE;
00281                         break;
00282 
00283                 case SM_NAME_RESOLVE:
00284                         // Wait for DNS resolution to complete
00285                         if(!DNSIsResolved(&Server.IPAddr)) 
00286                         {
00287                                 if((TickGet() - NTPdwTimer) > (5 * TICK_SECOND)) 
00288                                 {
00289                                         DNSEndUsage();
00290                                         NTPdwTimer = TickGetDiv64K();
00291                                         SNTPState = SM_SHORT_WAIT;
00292                                         NTPTestResponse = NTP_TEST_DNSERROR;
00293                                         #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00294                                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"SNTP: DNS did not resolve in time\r\n");
00295                                         #endif
00296                                 }
00297                                 break;
00298                         }
00299                         
00300                         // Obtain DNS resolution result
00301                         if(!DNSEndUsage())
00302                         {
00303                                 // No valid IP address was returned from the DNS 
00304                                 // server.  Quit and fail for a while if host is not valid.
00305                                 NTPdwTimer = TickGetDiv64K();
00306                                 SNTPState = SM_SHORT_WAIT;
00307                                 NTPTestResponse = NTP_TEST_DNSERROR;
00308                                 break;
00309                         }
00310                         SNTPState = SM_ARP_START_RESOLVE;
00311                         // No need to break
00312 
00313                 case SM_ARP_START_RESOLVE:
00314                 case SM_ARP_START_RESOLVE2:
00315                 case SM_ARP_START_RESOLVE3:
00316                         // Obtain the MAC address associated with the server's IP address 
00317                         ARPResolve(&Server.IPAddr);
00318                         NTPdwTimer = TickGet();
00319                         SNTPState++;
00320                 
00321                         #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00322                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"SNTP: start ARP\r\n");
00323                         #endif
00324                         
00325                         break;
00326 
00327                 case SM_ARP_RESOLVE:
00328                 case SM_ARP_RESOLVE2:
00329                 case SM_ARP_RESOLVE3:
00330                         // Wait for the MAC address to finish being obtained
00331                         if(!ARPIsResolved(&Server.IPAddr, &Server.MACAddr))
00332                         {
00333                                 // Time out if too much time is spent in this state
00334                                 if(TickGet() - NTPdwTimer > 1*TICK_SECOND)
00335                                 {
00336                                         // Retransmit ARP request by going to next SM_ARP_START_RESOLVE state or fail by going to SM_ARP_RESOLVE_FAIL state.
00337                                         SNTPState++;
00338                                 }
00339                                 break;
00340                         }
00341                         SNTPState = SM_UDP_SEND;
00342                         break;
00343 
00344                 case SM_ARP_RESOLVE_FAIL:
00345                         // ARP failed after 3 tries, abort and wait for next time query
00346                         NTPdwTimer = TickGetDiv64K();
00347                         SNTPState = SM_SHORT_WAIT;
00348                         NTPTestResponse = NTP_TEST_ARPERROR;
00349                         #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00350                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"SNTP: ARP failed\r\n");
00351                         #endif
00352 
00353                         break;
00354 
00355                 case SM_UDP_SEND:
00356                         // Open up the sending UDP socket
00357                         #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00358                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"SNTP: UDP send\r\n");
00359                         #endif
00360                         MySocket = UDPOpen(0, &Server, NTP_SERVER_PORT);
00361                         if(MySocket == INVALID_UDP_SOCKET)
00362                                 break;
00363 
00364                         // Make certain the socket can be written to
00365                         if(!UDPIsPutReady(MySocket))
00366                         {
00367                                 UDPClose(MySocket);
00368                                 break;
00369                         }
00370 
00371                         // Transmit a time request packet
00372                         memset(&pkt, 0, sizeof(pkt));
00373                         pkt.flags.versionNumber = 3;    // NTP Version 3
00374                         pkt.flags.mode = 3;                             // NTP Client
00375                         pkt.orig_ts_secs = swapl(NTP_EPOCH);
00376                         UDPPutArray((BYTE*) &pkt, sizeof(pkt)); 
00377                         UDPFlush();     
00378                         
00379                         NTPdwTimer = TickGet();
00380                         SNTPState = SM_UDP_RECV;                
00381                         break;
00382 
00383                 case SM_UDP_RECV:
00384                         // Look for a response time packet
00385                         if(!UDPIsGetReady(MySocket)) 
00386                         {
00387                                 if((TickGet()) - NTPdwTimer > NTP_REPLY_TIMEOUT)
00388                                 {
00389                                         // Abort the request and wait until the next timeout period
00390                                         UDPClose(MySocket);
00391                                         NTPdwTimer = TickGetDiv64K();
00392                                         SNTPState = SM_SHORT_WAIT;
00393                                         NTPTestResponse = NTP_TEST_TIMEOUT;
00394                                         #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00395                                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"SNTP: No response\r\n");
00396                                         #endif
00397                                         break;
00398                                 }
00399                                 break;
00400                         }
00401                         
00402                         #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00403                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"SNTP: UDP received\r\n");
00404                         #endif
00405                         
00406                         // Get the response time packet
00407                         w = UDPGetArray((BYTE*) &pkt, sizeof(pkt));
00408                         UDPClose(MySocket);
00409                         NTPdwTimer = TickGetDiv64K();
00410                         SNTPState = SM_WAIT;
00411 
00412                         // Validate packet size
00413                         if(w != sizeof(pkt)) 
00414                         {
00415                                 break;  
00416                         }
00417                         
00418                         // Set out local time to match the returned time
00419                         dwLastUpdateTick = TickGet();
00420                         dwSNTPSeconds = swapl(pkt.tx_ts_secs) - NTP_EPOCH;
00421                         // Do rounding.  If the partial seconds is > 0.5 then add 1 to the seconds count.
00422                         if(((BYTE*)&pkt.tx_ts_fraq)[0] & 0x80)
00423                                 dwSNTPSeconds++;
00424 
00425                         break;
00426 
00427                 case SM_SHORT_WAIT:
00428                         // Attempt to requery the NTP server after a specified NTP_FAST_QUERY_INTERVAL time (ex: 8 seconds) has elapsed.
00429                         if(TickGetDiv64K() - NTPdwTimer > (NTP_FAST_QUERY_INTERVAL/65536ull))
00430                                 SNTPState = SM_HOME;    
00431                         break;
00432 
00433                 case SM_WAIT:
00434                         
00435                         NTPTestResponse = NTP_TEST_COMPLETED;
00436                         // Requery the NTP server after a specified NTP_QUERY_INTERVAL time (ex: 10 minutes) has elapsed.
00437                         if(TickGetDiv64K() - NTPdwTimer > (NTP_QUERY_INTERVAL/65536ull))
00438                                 SNTPState = SM_HOME;    
00439 
00440                         break;
00441         }
00442 }
00443 
00444 
00445 /*****************************************************************************
00446   Function:
00447         DWORD SNTPGetUTCSeconds(void)
00448 
00449   Summary:
00450         Obtains the current time from the SNTP module.
00451 
00452   Description:
00453         This function obtains the current time as reported by the SNTP module.  
00454         Use this value for absolute time stamping.  The value returned is (by
00455         default) the number of seconds since 01-Jan-1970 00:00:00.
00456 
00457   Precondition:
00458         None
00459 
00460   Parameters:
00461         None
00462 
00463   Returns:
00464         The number of seconds since the Epoch.  (Default 01-Jan-1970 00:00:00)
00465         
00466   Remarks:
00467         Do not use this function for time difference measurements.  The Tick
00468         module is more appropriate for those requirements.
00469   ***************************************************************************/
00470 DWORD SNTPGetUTCSeconds(void)
00471 {
00472         DWORD dwTickDelta;
00473         DWORD dwTick;
00474 
00475         // Update the dwSNTPSeconds variable with the number of seconds 
00476         // that has elapsed
00477         dwTick = TickGet();
00478         dwTickDelta = dwTick - dwLastUpdateTick;
00479         while(dwTickDelta > TICK_SECOND)
00480         {
00481                 dwSNTPSeconds++;
00482                 dwTickDelta -= TICK_SECOND;
00483         }
00484         
00485         // Save the tick and residual fractional seconds for the next call
00486         dwLastUpdateTick = dwTick - dwTickDelta;
00487 
00488         return dwSNTPSeconds;
00489 }
